page.title: 08HUMSHAUGH HOME LIFE
page.content: MOST HOMES IN THE AREA HAVE WATER AND {ELECTRICITY,}TELEPHONE BUT NO{GAS;}A FEW OUTLYING HOMES HAVE COLD WATER ONLY, PERHAPS FROM A SPRING. OIL OR ELECTRICITY PROVIDES ANY CENTRAL HEAT- ING. MANY HOMES HAVE A MAINS DRAINAGE SYSTEM WHILE OTHERS HAVE A SEPTIC TANK. BECAUSE OF THE INFREQUENT BUS SERVICE OWN TRANSPORT IS ALMOST ESSEN- TIAL, SOME FAMILIES HAVE 2 CARS.{PETS; DOGS, CATS, GEESE, GOATS AND GOLDFISH BECOME PART OF THE FAMILY. MANY MOTHERS WORK BUT LABOUR SAVING APPLI- ANCES LIKE AUTOMATIC WASHING MACHINES, DEEP FREEZES AND MICROWAVE SAVE TIME AND STRESS. THE GENERAL STORE AND POST OFFICE STOCK MOST FOODS AND RE- QUISITES AND TRAVELLING SHOPS COME WEEKLY. CONVENIENCE{FOODS}ARE QUICK BUT TEND TO BE EXPENSIVE AND TODAY PEOPLE ARE VERY CONSCIOUS OF CALORIES, NUTRITION, DIETS AND HEALTHY EATING.
